intro: Aethionema pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean aethionema, is a low-growing annual plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Brassicaceae family.
